text: A two-story California Craftsman with a SOLD sign in the front yard. Yukon SUV pulls into the drive and stops. The driver's door opens and DEREK CHARLES steps out, a handsome and likable African-American in his early 30's; guy who's fought hard to make himself a success in busine and life. Derek wears a business suit and the first thing does is cross the lawn to the SOLD sign. With a new homeowner's look of satisfaction, Derek grips SOLD sign and pulls it out of the ground.
Derek?
D erek looks over to where his pretty wife BETH is standi beside the SUV, holding their cute 2 year old son KYLE in arms. Beth shakes her head with amusement.
What are you going to do with that?
The SOLD sign, now in pieces, burns brightly in the fireplace. The rest of the room is empty except for KYLE is nearby, asleep in his stroller. Derek and Beth's VOICE drift down from upstairs.
This is coming down.
Why?
Do you want people to think we put it up?
(soft chuckle) I don't know. I kind of like it.
Please tell me you're joking.
Derek and Beth stare up at their own reflections in a hug ceiling mirror. The rest of the room is vacant.
All I'm saying, before we take it down... maybe we should try it out.
You know. Christen the new house.
And what do you suggest we use for a bed?
What do we need a bed for when we've got a fine shag carpet?
(LAUGHS) Because I'm gonna have fine shag carpet tattoos all over my --
Derek puts his arms around her waist and pulls her close. Beth resists -- but only slightly. BETH (cont'd) Don't you have to go to work?
(nuzzling her neck) Told `em I'd be late.
What about...
Kyle? That boy wouldn't wake up if a nuclear bomb went off.
Maybe not, but the movers...
Won't be here for another hour.
Beth smiles, giving in. They look up at themselves in the mirror like naughty teenagers.
Derek, you are so bad.
Isn't THAT why you married me?
As they begin to kiss passionately...
Distorted images of Derek and Beth in the mirror's reflection, naked bodies intertwined, making love on the carpet.
Kyle continues to snooze in his stroller. Outside the window, a moving van arrives and BLOWS its horn.
Beth, drowsing in Derek's arms.    They stir at the sound the horn.
Want me to stay?     Crack the whip on these guys?
No. Go to work and earn that promotion. Somebody's got to pay for all this.
They share a quick kiss and then Beth swings over to find clothes. As Beth dresses, Derek stares up at himself.    He smiles satisfaction. Life is good.

OVERS bring in furniture, placing a big glass table in th dining room area below the stairs. Nearby, Beth opens a box and removes family pictures. She arranges them with loving care on the mantle above the fi place.
FRAMED PHOTOS of Derek and Beth in their early dating day at their wedding, celebrating holidays, Beth pregnant, th birth of Kyle; photos illustrating the history of this ha family.

Picture of Beth and Kyle smiling at him from the dash, De drives the freeway toward the skyscrapers of downtown. He listens to the stock and financial report. Then, switches over to CD and Gnarls Barkley's "Gone Daddy Gone" blares The two sides of Derek Charles.                        C
ANGLING DOWN from a towering glass and steel office build as Derek's Yukon enters the parking garage.

Derek and several others ride up from the parking garage. Derek scans the Business page of a folded newspaper. he elevator stops on the ground floor, the door slides op and MORE PEOPLE get on. The doors shut and the car ascend t other floors, people get on and off until it's just Der and one other passenger: LISA SHERIDAN, balancing an arm load of thick files. She's in her mid-20's, white, beautiful, glasses and hair pulled back projecting an efficient, smart and sophisticated look; simple blouse an skirt, high heels, great legs. Lisa glances over at Derek, intrigued.
Gage/Bendix?
Derek looks up from his paper with a distracted smile.
Excuse me?
I couldn't help but notice we're both going to Seven.
Right.   Gage/Bendix.   I work there.
I thought you might.
Do you have an appointment with us?
Why?   Do I look like a client?
Actually, you do.
(pleasant laugh) W ell, I hate to shatter the illusion but I'm just a lowly temp.
(genuinely surprised) You're a temp?
Just here for the day.
Well, you could have fooled me.
Lisa shifts on her feet.
I'm beginning to think these heels were a big mistake.
Derek glances down at her shapely legs. LISA (cont'd) I should have worn my track shoes. They've got me running all over town picking up these disclosure --
That's when the pile in her arms slides south.       The fall to the floor and spread out in a mess. Lisa LAUGHS and drops to her knees. LISA (cont'd) God, I'm such a klutz.
Derek bends down to help.     Their hands touch briefly.
No problem. Happen to anybody.
They straighten up, look at each other. he door slides open, revealing the sleek and vast offices GAGE BENDIX, ALTERNATIVE ASSET MANAGEMENT.
Thanks.   I owe you one.
CAMERA FOLLOWS Derek through a warren of cubicles where S WORKERS attend phones and computers. He becomes aware tha Lisa is right behind him.
(with humor) Are you following me?
No. I'm taking these files to Mister Charles' office. They said it was this way.
Derek Charles?
I guess you probably know him.
Oh, yeah, I know him. (lowers his voice) Kind of an asshole, takes himself waaaay too seriously. But don't tell him I said that.     L
I could get you into trouble?
Deep trouble.

Approaching a desk where Derek's assistant, a mild-lookin man in his late 30's named PATRICK looks up and smiles. Across from Patrick is another desk and another assistant middle-aged woman named MARGE.
Morning, Derek. How's the new house?
Total chaos. Lucky for me, I sneaked out as soon as the movers showed up.
Beth must have loved that.
If she calls mad -- and she will -- tell her I'm in a meeting.
Remember who used to sit at this desk? She'll know I am lying.
(with a smile) Good point.
Patrick CHUCKLES as Derek enters his office and vanishes inside. Patrick notices Lisa standing there with her arm load of files.
(to Lisa) Can I help you?
Lisa stares at Derek's office.
That's Derek Charles?
Yes.
Lisa breaks into a smile; obviously charmed. Patrick takes amused notice of Lisa's interest in Derek. PATRICK (cont'd) (TEASING) Watch it, girl. He's married.
The good ones are always married.
(dramatic sigh) Or straight.
Derek sits at a long table with his silver-haired boss, J GAGE and his best friend and co-worker BEN KINGMAN. One w of the room is glass, giving a view of the outer office activity.            G
(to Derek) Did you talk to our German friend, Herr Ganz?
Matter of fact, I just got off the line to Berlin.
And?
Ganz doesn't like the way the Stock Market's been gyrating and he thinks the hedge fund wave is about to crest.
You think he's right?

Hell, no. I think he's a hundred percent wrong. We haven't even gotten close to that point yet. Hedge fund demand is coming from individual investors which is why it's gaining mainstream acceptance. You know Ganz. He gets paranoid when anything goes mainstream. He started making Auf Wiedersehen noises but I managed to talk him into a private equity portfolio instead... to the tune of 155 mil.
(PLEASED) I knew there was a reason I promoted you. No offense, Ben.
None taken, Joe. I'm just honored to be allowed to exist in Derek's world.
Derek looks over at Ben who winks at him. They're friends and good-natured ribbing is part of their relationship.
Good. I want you to throw Derek all your support on this one.
hat's when Lisa walks by on the other side of the glass. Gage perks up. GAGE (cont'd) Whose legs are those?
Never seen `em before.
I think she's one of the temps.
You mean temptress...
Remind me to call that agency and have them send over a couple more just like her. Doesn't hurt to have a little eye candy around the office, does it, boys?
Ben agrees. Derek merely nods.        He's not comfortabl this tone of sexism.
End of the day. Workers are leaving. Derek passes an open office door. Ben sticks his head out.
I scored an extra Lakers ticket for tomorrow night. Think you can get free?
I'm moving into a new house.
So?
Do I look like a man who wants a divorce?
I could call and say it's a work emergency.
Thanks, but I think I'll stay married instead.
Coward.
Ben ducks back into his office.      Derek walks past a c on their way to the elevator.
Good night, Mister Charles.
Derek stops, turns and sees Lisa sitting at a computer station. She smiles. L ISA (cont'd) You punk'd me.
Sorry but you set me up.
(with humor) Don't worry. I'll get my revenge.    And by the way, you might like to know everybody who works here strongly disagrees with you.
About what?
About Derek Charles being an asshole. They all say he's the nicest guy in the firm.
Well, that just proves he's got `em all fooled.
And he's humble, too.   I'm Lisa, by the way. Lisa Sheridan.
Well, it was nice to meet you, Lisa Sheridan. Good luck with your next job --
erek continues on to the elevator.      Lisa calls after
Actually, they're keeping me on a few more days, so I'll probably see you on Monday.

Can't tell if he heard. Lisa watches him go out of sight, then, curious, she turns to her computer and pulls up Der bio and picture on the company web site: "Derek Charles graduated from UCLA with a major in financ Began his career with major Wall Street Brokerage firm be joining Gage/Bendix working with clients to help them accomplish their investment objectives. From asset allocation and investment planning, pension analysis, etc
Kyle is asleep in his crib. Derek and Beth look down on h smiling, then move quietly toward the door. Before they c sneak out, Kyle lets out A CRY. They look at each other.
Damn.   Almost made it.
Your turn.
erek returns to the crib and picks up Kyle.
Hey, little man. What's wrong?    You should be... (feeling him) Uh oh. Poopy diaper. Beth...
(in the doorway; with a laugh) I've been changing him all day.
Beth leaves. Derek carries Kyle over to the changing tabl opens Kyle's diaper and turns away.
Whew.   What's that woman been feeding you?

Derek and Beth sit at a table on the outside deck that overhangs a sheer drop to the canyon below. In the distan the LA basin sparkles like a diamond in the night. Derek and Beth are happy but exhausted. In front of them an empty pizza box. Derek picks up a bottle of champagne pours some for Beth and himself. They're both a little drunk.
Well, we toasted the house --
Toasted Kyle --
Your promotion --
But I've saved the most important toast for last... (raising his glass) To my beautiful wife who I love and adore more than anything in the world.
And to my handsome husband. I asked for the moon and he gave me the stars.
hey clink glasses and drink. BETH (cont'd) Derek...
(YAWNS) Uh huh?
How would you feel about trying out that mirror again? This time in our own bed.
(perks up) Yeah? Give the magic mirror another test drive?
You know how I like looking at your sexy butt.
Beth, you are so bad.
Isn't that WHY you married ME?
Derek arrives to find Lisa sitting at his outer desk in Patrick's place. She looks up and smiles. She's not weari her glasses and her hair is down giving her a softer, les severe look.
Hi.   Remember me?
Lisa Sheridan, Girl Temp.     Where's Patrick?
Out with the flu. I did some trading with the other temps and wrangled your desk. I hope that's okay.
Uh... sure.
Looking over at the assistant outside the other corner office. DEREK (cont'd) Hey Marge.
Good morning, Derek.
Back to the temp.
Grab your pad and follow me.
Derek goes into his office.       Lisa collects her thing does as told.
Derek goes behind the desk as Lisa enters and sits down o the couch. She crosses her legs. Those great legs.
I put a memo on your desk about the Christmas party this Friday.
Is it that time already?
Derek picks up the memo and scans it.
Why don't they invite spouses?
How's that?
To the Christmas party.    It says "for employees only."

It's like that in most companies. They think people are more inhibited in front of their spouses, less likely to kick back and enjoy themselves and mingle with co-workers, which is what the party is about.
So, does this party get pretty wild?
Just the opposite.
Well that's no fun.
Derek notices a container of Starbucks coffee. LISA (cont'd) I called Patrick. He said you like it black with two sugars.
Derek is impressed.    He opens the container. LISA (cont'd) If it's cold, I can run down and nuke it in the Break Room.
(takes a sip) No, it's perfect.
Lisa is pleased.    She raises her pad and pencil.
Fire away.
Well, it's Monday and first thing on Monday...
I took care of that.
Took care of what?
On Mondays you always send your wife a dozen long-stemmed red roses. (off Derek's look of surprise) I called to confirm they've been delivered.
Thanks.
I think that's incredibly sweet.   How long have you two been married?
Three years in March.
And you still send her flowers every Monday morning? Lucky girl.
It's kind of a tradition.
Patrick said you started sending them back when Beth worked here as your assistant. Is that how you won her heart?
Well, it took a little more than roses. (getting down to business) We need to run some calls.
(POISED) Ready when you are.
Are you always this efficient?
Does that surprise you?
Well, it's just that most of the temps we get here...
I think you'll find I'm not your typical temp.
No.   Definitely not.

Okay not your typical temp... start with Phil Trendle at Emerson... set up a lunch for end of the week. Wherever he wants but push the Water Grill. Then Terry Mills at Imagio. Am I going too fast for you?
No.    Go faster.   I can handle it.
Beth is feeding Kyle while talking on the phone to Derek.
It's a beautiful little park with a duck pond and close enough to push Kyle.

INTERCUTTING DEREK IN HIS OFFICE, while he listens and go over reports. BETH (cont'd) I've already met a dozen other women with kids the same age. One of them, Lauren something asked if we'd like to come over for a barbecue on Saturday.
I don't know. It's shaping up to be a work weekend.
Outside, at her desk, Lisa eavesdrops on her headset, listening with interest.
You can work at home and then we'll go to the barbecue.

s Beth chats on, Derek gets a weird feeling. Still on the phone, he slowly gets up from his desk and moves quietly the door. He looks out, expecting to catch Lisa listening in. Instead, she's not at her desk. She's standing severa feet away at a file cabinet. She turns and smiles at him.
Do you need me?
Derek shakes his head no and steps back into his office.
Derek finishes some work on his home computer.       In t background, Beth sits in bed reading a book.
Work at the office.     This is home.   Come to bed.
In a sec.
Derek finishes. He rises, walks over to the bed and climb in beside Beth. She puts her book on the night table and switches off the light. They cuddle together. Beth CHUCKLES.
The card that came today with the roses...
Uh huh?
... was addressed "To Betty."
Betty?
(with humor) Yeah. Who's Betty?
Blame it on the new girl. Patrick called in sick and I had a temp on my desk.
I thought we had a deal. No female assistants.
Honey, I don't control the temp pool.
She pretty?
Derek gives Beth a look. ETH (cont'd) Just asking...
Yeah, she's pretty... plain.
I don't care. I want her fired immediately.
Actually, she did a great job... aside from the card.
They get comfortable.      Beth puts her head on Derek's
Night, Derek.
Night... Betty.
Beth LAUGHS, gives him a playful punch.
TWO DELIVERY GUYS come out of the stairwell, struggling w an undecorated Christmas tree. Marge directs them to a sp to put it.
Beth and Kyle are visiting. Derek has Kyle on his desk, letting him play with his keys.
Hope you don't mind us dropping in unannounced.
You kidding? This is a treat.
Sheila's meeting us for lunch at Central Market. Then I'm taking Kyle to the Grove. (to Kyle) And who are we going to see at the Grove?
Santa!
(to Derek) You want to come?   Get your picture taken on Santa's lap?
I'd love to but I'm all jammed up.     But say hi to your sister.
That guy she was seeing, the one we met at Thanksgiving... Jack.
The one she said was perfect.
Apparently he's not so perfect.   He told her he just wants to be FWB.
FWB?
Friends With Benefits.
What does that mean?
You know.    Sex but no commitments.
And Sheila's got a problem with that?
Beth laughs.       Lisa appears at the door.
Excuse me.
They turn.    Lisa smiles sweetly.
Lisa, this is my wife Beth.       Beth, Lisa. She's temping for Patrick.
(friendly but checking her out) Hi.
It's great to meet you, Mrs. Charles. eyes lighting up) And this must be Kyle. I can already tell he's going to grow up to be a heartbreaker.
Lisa comes over.       Kyle presses shyly against Derek. LISA (cont'd) Hi, Kyle.     I'm Lisa.
When Kyle doesn't respond...
Kyle, say hello.
He can say hello. He's usually not this shy around strangers.
What a handsome boy. (to Derek) He looks just like you.
Actually, most people think he takes after Beth.
Talk about the perfect family. The three of you should be on a magazine cover.
I hope my husband's not working you too hard.
(cheery tone) He is. But I like it. I'm learning a lot. (to Derek) Joe Gage needs to see you when you get a minute.
Well, that's our cue to leave.    We just dropped in to say hi. (taking Kyle from Derek) Come on, big boy.
Lisa steps back, moves off to the door.
It was great to meet you... Beth.
You, too... Laura.
She did it on purpose, winking at Derek.    He smiles.
Lisa.
Excuse me?
It's Lisa.      You said Laura.
I did?
If Lisa knows she's being fucked with, she doesn't show i BETH (cont'd) Sorry.   Lisa.
(WAVING) Bye, Kyle. Say hi to Santa for me.
Lisa exits.   A beat.
(to Beth) That was intentional.
Wasn't me. Blame "Betty."    So what's the deal with her?
What do you mean?
She knew I was taking Kyle to Santa.
So?
So she was obviously listening at the door.
Well, she probably didn't know when to come in.
I thought you said she was plain. Derek, that girl may be a lot of things but one of them is not plain.
How would I know?    I only have eyes for you.      B
(LAUGHS) Oh, you are so slick.
They put Kyle in his stroller.
Come on. I'll walk you to the elevator. You can say hi to the old gang. (BEAT) Ever miss it?
I like to think I traded up.
Derek beams.    They share a kiss.
Derek, Beth and Kyle are surrounded by office workers mak a fuss over Beth and Kyle. Even Joe Gage comes out of his office to embrace Beth and chat.

Lisa watches from a distance. Her face betrays no emotion After a moment, she turns and enters Derek's office. isa sits behind the desk in Derek's chair and look at a framed picture on Derek's desk -- Derek, Beth and Kyle, t perfect happy family. Nearby, Lisa sees a pile of CD's.    She looks through th smiles with an idea.
A warm LA morning with a hot sun coming up.    Derek driv work, listening to Gnarls' "Crazy."
Workers hang bulbs and decorations on the Christmas tree. festive holiday spirit is in the air. Derek exits the elevator, heads to his office.      Patri back at his desk.    D
Hey, Patrick. Feeling better?
Much. Thanks.
You know it's going to take more than the flu to keep me away from that Christmas party.
Not sure we can say the same for Marge...
Derek turns to see Lisa, now sitting at Marge's desk.
You get around don't you?
Poor thing called in with a fever...
Yeah... She's not speaking to me at the moment.
he three share a laugh.
Alright.   You two behave yourselves out here...
erek goes into his office.       We stay with Patrick and
(whispers to Lisa) So, how many times did you get busted listening in on Derek's calls?
(light laugh) I'm way too devious to ever get caught. Besides, I thought all you assistants listened in.
(with a smile) We do.
A beat.   Lisa wonders if she might make a friend here.
How long have you worked here?
Ten years this Spring.
I'll bet you know more about what goes on behind these closed doors than anybody.
Oh you got that right girl.    I know all the dirty little secrets.
Well maybe we should grab a drink some night after work for a little girl talk.
(lonely guy; flattered by her
Listen, honey, if you think you can buy my silence with a couple of Cosmo's... you're right.
They share a laugh, bonding.
Deserted at lunch hour. Derek, in shirtsleeves, emerges f his office and approaches the Break Room.

Derek enters, opens the refrigerator and takes out a lunc bag. He hears a slight SNIFFLING NOISE, turns and is surprised to find Lisa seated a corner table, a little tearful. Lisa looks up, quickly wipes her eyes with her hand and p on a smile.
Sorry.     I thought everybody was at lunch.
An awkward moment.    Lisa starts to rise. LISA (cont'd) I should go...
No. Stay. I was just gonna take this back to my office.
Lisa sits back down.    Derek starts to leave; hesitates. DEREK (cont'd) Anything I can do to help?     I mean... if you want to talk about it.
It's nothing.
Most people I know don't cry over nothing.
( with humor) You think I was crying?     This is just my allergies.
Uh huh.     What are you allergic to?
Men, apparently. Actually it's more like they're allergic to me.
Boyfriend trouble?
Lisa hesitates, wondering if she can confide.
It's stupid really. (a beat) This guy I've been seeing just calls and dumps me. Middle of the day. No warning. No explanation. Just "I don't think we should see each other anymore."
OUCH!!! That's pretty cold.    How long were you together?
Two months. small laugh) Actually, it was one of my longer lasting relationships. I don't know what it is but sooner or later I just seem to scare men off.
I'm starting to think there's something wrong with me.
Derek sits down beside her.       He puts a comforting ha shoulder.
(like a big brother) Nothing wrong with you. Your boyfriend's a fool, that's all.
I wish I could believe that.
Maybe you just haven't met the right guy yet.
I'm beginning to think all the good ones are taken. D
Look, I'm no expert but if it didn't work out, maybe it wasn't meant to be. When the right guy comes along... you'll know it.
She looks up at him; smiles.
Is that how it was with you and Beth?
Actually, yeah.      We both knew pretty quick.
Love at first sight?
It does happen.
Great.     Now I'm jealous.
Why?
She's got it all.   Perfect husband, perfect child, perfect marriage.

Nobody's perfect. There are problems in every relationship. The important thing is to keep moving forward. trying to buck her up) Don't get down on yourself. You're a bright, attractive girl. Any man would be lucky to have you.
Oh, yeah.     Right.
No, really. If I was single...
But you're not.
I just meant...
I know. You're just trying to make me feel better. (touches his hand) And you have.
Lisa gets up.
LISA (cont'd) Thanks, Derek.
Hang in there. It'll happen.
Lisa nods.    She smiles and exits. ncident forgotten, Derek opens his lunch bag and takes ou sandwich.
en appears in the doorway, grins at Derek.
What was that all about?
Poor kid got dumped by her boyfriend.
Really? I wouldn't mind taking up the slack. That is one hot piece of ass there. (off Derek's look) Like you haven't noticed.
Hey, I'm a happily married man.   And so are you.
Doesn't mean we can't look.

Ben goes to the refrigerator, opens it and starts rooting around. BEN (cont'd) Not like the old days, back when you could get away with a little office nookie on the side and not get nailed for it. (turns and gives him a grin) Don't give me that "I'm appalled" look. That's how you got together with Beth, isn't it?
Ben, if you're looking to start something with that girl...
You saw her first?
Fuck off.
Besides, I don't think I'm her type.     Now you on the other hand...
Ben, do me a favor...
All I'm just sayin' is a lot of these single gals see the work place as a hunting ground. cocking his finger like a gun) And this one's got you in the cross hairs.
With a grin, Ben "pulls the trigger -- bang!" and exits. Derek looks a little annoyed.                          C

Derek at his desk. He notices an envelope with his name o it. He opens the envelope. A note and a home-made CD slid out. "Thanks for the shoulder, Lisa.   (Thought you might like these.)" Curious, Derek feeds the CD into his computer, lowers the volume and is hit with Gnarls Barkley in concert. He turn down the volume and smiles, continues to listen. He hear the ding of an IM on his computer.     It's from

head_text.subj: TIS THE SEASON TO BE GNARLY.

text: Derek considers, types back.
Reply: CONCERT BOOTLEG.   TOTALLY ILLEGAL.   WE COULD BE ARRESTED. He responds: WORTH THE RISK.   I LUV GNARLS.
Reply: ME 2 He responds:   THANX.    GET BACK 2 WORK. She replies: GONE DADDY GONE. Derek smiles, then goes back to work.
Breakfast. Beth and Derek at the table. Derek is feeding Kyle. We can see a naked, undecorated Christmas tree in t next room.
On your way home, can you pick up those Baby Einstein DVD's for you know who.
I'll have to do it tomorrow.      Office party's tonight.
I forgot. Well, if you drink too much, take a cab, okay?
If it's anything like last year, I'll be home early. (THEN) Kyle, I want you to eat this.
Kyle shakes his head "no" and points at the Christmas tre
Santa!
Yeah, Santa. And he's coming soon. So eat. Don't you know Santa only brings presents to boys who eat all their food?
Kyle considers; then furiously eats.    Derek and Beth LA
Derek sits at the bar by himself, reading the paper. He looks up and sees Lisa come in. Lisa catches Derek's eye, surprised. Then she smiles, starts to make her way over..
(gesturing to the empty stool next to him) This seat taken?
(always a good guy) No. Be my guest...
Lisa is sitting next to Derek at the bar. The food has co DEREK (cont'd)
Still the best burger in town.
Lisa chews and nods in agreement. EREK (CONT'D) (cont'd)
... And the best Margarita.
(raises her eyebrows) Really?
We used to cut loose here after a long day at work.
Work hard, play hard.   Right?
Back in the day...
How's that boyfriend trouble coming?
Keep moving forward, right?
Exactly.
How about you, Derek?   What's the grand plan?
You know, run the company by 35. Jet by 40. Retire to my private island and own the Lakers by 50.
isa laughs.
Lakers suck.
Not with me in charge.
Touche.   They both smile.
You want one?
What?
A margarita?
Oh, I don't know.
C'mon big talker... it's Christmas time. Works dead --
Derek's not sure. LISA (cont'd) I won't tell if you don't.
All right. One.     What do you like? Strawberry?
Rocks. Salt...
The Christmas party is in full swing with MUSIC, TWO BARTENDERS and lowered lights.   The tree is all lit up. mood is happy and playful and people are getting a little tipsy.

A MALE WORKER gives A FEMALE WORKER a back massage with a computer mouse. Joe Gage, in a Santa suit, is passing out gag presents. Lisa is in a group with Patrick and some other women, chatting. She glances over and sees Derek. He's off to the side with Ben, sipping drinks. esks and furniture are shoved back and workers are free- style dancing, crowding into the center of the room. arge grabs Derek by the arm and pulls him out. Derek make some half-hearted dance moves, then gets into the spirit. It's crowded, people are close together and a moment late Derek finds himself dancing face to face with Lisa.
(with humor) Well, if it isn't the Office Asshole.
That's Mister Office Asshole to you.
I'm impressed.      You can dance.
All those years watching Soul Train.
I wasn't sure I was going to come tonight.
Why not?
Well, it's not like I've been here that long.
I'm sure everybody's glad you decided to show up.
Even you?
What do you mean "even me?" I'm your number one supporter around here.
This makes her smile happily.
(looking up) Uh oh.
Derek looks up, too.       They're under the mistletoe.
How did that get there?
They look at each other, smile.       An awkward moment. laughs it off.
(PLAYFUL) Maybe a quick one on the cheek? If we don't, people will really suspect there's something going on.
But Derek steps away.
Guess we'll just have to take that chance.
(good natured laugh) Coward.
The music changes, breaking the mood.       Derek smiles and slips away, rejoining Ben. erek looks at his watch.
You're not thinking about bailing, are you? Fun's just getting started. Remember last year? Sally Sloane did a table dance.

e indicates a pretty secretary LAUGHING and accepting another drink. BEN (cont'd) I give her one more drink, then stand back.   How about you, buddy? Need a re- fill? Come on, where's your holiday spirit?
With Beth and Kyle.       I'm gonna take a piss and sneak out.
You're no fun.

What man wouldn't? The attentions of a pretty young girl? I can just see those adoring blue eyes batting at you every time you told her how pretty she looked or what a nice dress --
Stop it, Beth. You know I never said those things.
You must have said something. Done something to give her the idea.
If I did, it wasn't intentional.
She was in your bed, Derek! You spent the night together and you want me to believe nothing happened?
I was passed out... drunk.     Nothing happened.
Damn you, Derek.   Damn you.
Beth turns away, her face burning.
I love you, Beth. I love Kyle and the life we have together. I would never do anything to screw that up. This girl is disturbed. She's seriously disturbed and for some reason, she fixated on me.
Why?
I don't know. She's crazy.
You should have told me. From the very beginning, you should have told me.
I know.
Why didn't you?
At first I thought it was no big deal. And then... I was just embarrassed. I didn't know how to explain it to you without looking...
Guilty?
I said I was wrong.
A beat.
Did she know about us, Derek?
What?
How we met?
Don't do this, Beth.    You'll make yourself sick.
I'm already sick.
Honey, I know I screwed up...
Derek reaches out. DEREK (cont'd) But I've told you the truth.    I have to know you believe me.
(weary sigh) I don't know what to believe. All I know is, I need to be alone for awhile.
Beth, don't --
I need to be alone --
Beth moves quickly upstairs. Leaving Derek there. He sits back on the couch, head in his hands. At a loss. After a
Derek makes a determined rush up after her. Only to find bedroom door locked. Derek's upset. Resigned, he makes his way over to--
He grabs a pillow. Punches it twice. Knows he's in the do
Lisa is propped up in a hospital bed, a dark brooding expression on her face, tangled hair hanging down. Just staring, eyes wide, a little dopey looking.
Monica Reyes appears in the doorway.
Miss Reynolds? I'm Monica Reyes.
isa looks up.      Her face transforms into a bright smil
Come in. I'm sorry I'm such a mess but they won't let me take a shower or wash my hair. (dismissive laugh) Apparently I'm still on suicide watch.
I'm a police officer assigned to your case. How are you feeling?
Well, still a bit groggy from the medication. But it isn't stopping me from feeling ashamed for all the trouble I've caused.
Do you feel like talking about the other night?
Have you spoken to Derek?
Yes.
And he's all right?
Relatively speaking.
When can I see him?
See him?
Derek.
I'm afraid that's not possible.
Why?
Miss Sheridan, I don't think Mister Charles wants to speak to you or continue any kind of contact.
Lisa looks at her oddly.
Then why did he send these? Really?
Lisa indicates a bouquet of flowers in a vase nearby.
(keeping the surprise out of her voice) He sent you flowers?
Peonies.   My favorite.
Reyes inspects the attached card. "Lisa Darling, the othe night was just a misunderstanding. Don't ever leave me. Love always, Derek."
When did these show up?
A few hours ago.    They're lovely, aren't they?
eyes decides not to push it, goes into her Q & A:
Can you tell me what happened at the hotel, why you were there.
Didn't Derek tell you?
I'd like to hear your version.
There's not a lot to tell. We got together at the hotel and you can guess what we did.
Slept together.    Had sex.
Of course.
Derek denies it.
He's just being a gentleman, trying to protect me.
I see.     Go on.
The next day when Derek told me his wife wouldn't give him a divorce and that we could never see each other again, I guess I over reacted.
I didn't realize he was just being noble.
Noble?
He was thinking about his little boy, Kyle... what the breakup might do to him. He's not even two, you know. My parents broke up when I was pretty young. It leaves a scar that never really heals.
So you believe Mister Charles is in love with you? L
Read the card. Derek and I belong together and nothing can change that. But I do feel bad about his wife.
You do?

I'm not a home-wrecker. I'm not stealing him away. Their marriage is dead and Beth is in denial. It can't be easy to find out that the man she loves is in love with another woman. I just hope she doesn't do something foolish. strange smile) You know the old saying.
What's that?
"Hell hath no fury like a woman scorned."
Lisa could almost be talking about herself.   Reyes nods she's chilled.
You take it easy now.   We'll talk again.
She excuses herself.   Lisa goes back to happily smiling her flowers.
Derek and Joe Gage.
I don't have to tell you how an incident like this could impact the company. Even the slightest whiff of impropriety...
There was no impropriety, Joe. This is just the sick fantasy of a very disturbed girl.
Who might retaliate by hitting us with a sexual harassment lawsuit.
There was no sexual harassment. If anything, I'm the one who was sexually harassed. (SIGHS) I can't believe this is happening to me. It's like a nightmare.
By now, you're probably wishing you had fucked her.
erek gives him a shocked look.
OE (cont'd) For all the trouble it's costing you. (THEN) Sorry. Bad joke.
Goddamit, Joe, if there's an injured party here, it's me.
Derek, calm down. I believe you and you know I'll back you up all the way. But if I find out there was something going on, I won't have a choice.
That's not going to happen because there's nothing to find out.
Good. Then you have nothing to worry about. Meantime I'm going to put Ben on the Ganz account.
But Ganz is my client --
Look, maybe you should take some time off. Just til this blows over.

Sorry to interrupt. Derek, there's a Detective Reyes here to see you.

With your credit card.

More?

text: This is... none of this ever happened. I was never at her apartment. I never even touched her, let alone did any of this...
According to those entries, you're quite the accomplished lover, Mister Charles. And you made promises to her, promises to divorce your wife and marry her...
You can't possibly believe this.
Whether I believe it or not is irrelevant. The only thing that matters is that she believes it.
There's got to be something I can do to protect myself... my family.
You could file a restraining order.    But that may not be necessary.
Why not?

Lisa's left town. She was released in the custody of an older sister yesterday. Her sister flew down from San Francisco and took her back. Lisa's agreed to check herself into a neuropsychiatric hospital up there.
(some relief) Well, I can't say I'm unhappy to hear she's gone. Maybe now she can get the help she needs.
W ith any luck, Mister Charles, you'll never hear from her again.

Beth moves through the room, stopping to pick up one of Kyle's toys. She looks through the sliding glass window a sees Derek on the deck, holding Kyle in his arms. They're playing a game. Derek points to objects in the distance a Kyle identifies them. "Truck... doggie... bird..." and so on. A tear in Beth's eye.   She comes closer.   They don't se
(singing to Kyle) "Four little ducks went out one day... over the hill and far away..."
A few days later.
A 14 year old baby sitter SAMANTHA walks Beth and Derek t the front door. They're dressed for a night out.
You've got our cell numbers so if there's any problem, don't hesitate to call us, okay?
Come on, honey.     Samantha knows what to do, don't you?
I've got four little brothers.    Trust me. I'm really good at this.
ut Beth remains concerned.
(to Derek) I don't know. Maybe we should...

No way. Do you know how hard it was to get these reservations? Come on, we agreed. This is an important night. And I am not gonna waste you in that outfit. (to Samantha) She looks fantastic, doesn't she?
Like a movie star.
erek takes Beth by the arm.
Everything's gonna be fine.

Lock this.     We'll be back by ten.
Have fun.

Derek and Beth sit together in a romantic candle-lit boot working on a bottle of wine.
I haven't seen you looking this relaxed and beautiful in weeks.
I'd forgotten what this was like... the two of us out together.
Yeah.    It's been awhile.
He looks at her. It's been awhile since they've touched o had sex, too. Beth smiles a little shyly, drops her eyes. DEREK (cont'd) (ENCOURAGED) So... there's hope?
It's not that easy.
I need you to believe me.
Derek pours the last of the bottle into Beth's glass and signals the Waiter. DEREK (cont'd) Could we get another bottle, please?
Derek smiles at Beth.        She looks at her wine glass.
Derek, not everybody gets drunk and does things they regret.
Derek looks like he's been punched in the face.
I keep telling you I didn't do any thing to regret.
Beth looks up and gives him a hard, cold look.
I am telling you... you did.

amantha is sprawled on the couch. The TV is going, she's listening to music on her I-pod while texting a friend on phone and paging through a teen magazine all at the same time, multi-tasking. She doesn't hear the door bell RING the first time. Or th second. Then there's a LOUD KNOCKING. Samantha becomes aware, looks around, then sees a shadowy figure through t frosted window next to the door. With a SIGH of annoyance, Samantha gets up and goes to th door. She unlocks and opens it. Lisa is standing on the threshold, looking fresh and pretty and smiling.
(super friendly) Hi, I'm Beth's friend Allie.      She's expecting me.
Lisa breezes right in.
Mister and Mrs. Charles are out.
Out?
They went to dinner.
What? Beth told me to drop by. That's strange. Oh well, I have something for Kyle. I'll just run up and give it to him.
You can't.     He's sleeping.
Oh, I won't wake him.
Maybe you should come back.
But I'm here right now. Why should I... oh, I see. Just doing your duty. Good girl. You know what, let me call Beth.

Lisa takes out a cell phone, punches in a number.      Sa looks relieved. LISA (cont'd) (into her cell) Beth? Hey, girlfriend. It's Allie. Where am I? Where are you! I'm at your place. You told me to come by.

to Samantha) No it's okay. She forgot. (back into cell) No, Samantha was a little concerned so I said I'd call you. (winks at Samantha) Yeah. Okay, honey. You two have a great night. (to Samantha; holding out the
Oh, wait. Did you want to talk to her?
Samantha shakes her head "no." LISA (cont'd) (into cell) Beth, I'll call you tomorrow.
Lisa clicks off. LISA (cont'd) (to Samantha) Great. This will only take me a minute.
Lisa crosses to the stairs and goes up.      Samantha ret the couch and resumes texting.

yle is asleep in his crib. The door cracks open, emitting light from the hall, turning Lisa into a silhouette. She enters the room, silent as a ghost, and approaches Kyle's crib. She stands over him, smiling down at the vulnerable sleeping child. Then, Lisa turns away and looks at herself in a mirror.
She takes out a tube of red lipstick and applies it to he lips.
Samantha is listening to i-pod music/texting/watching TV. the background, out of focus, Lisa comes down the stairs.

(preoccupied; doesn't even

Lisa vanishes. Samantha sends a last message, then thinks she ought to check on the baby. She gets up, starts for t stairs when she gets another text message on her phone. S checks it, laughs and returns to the couch to text her fr back.                                                  C
Derek and Beth drive home in tense silence.   Finally, Be speaks.
It's his birthday tomorrow.
I know.
I told him we'd take him to Legoland.
I'll go on-line tonight and order the tickets. Unless you think you should take him alone.
No. Whatever we're going through, he needs us to be together.
Derek turns the corner to their street. The house comes i sight. The garage door goes up. Derek pulls into the driv and guides the car into the garage.
A key in the lock.     The door opens.    Derek and Beth On the couch, Samantha ends her texting and greets them w a bright smile.
Hey! You guys got back so fast--
Any trouble with Kyle?
No.  He was a doll.
But you just missed your friend.
Beth and Derek freeze, turn and look at each other.
What friend?
You know. Allie? She was just here... called you on the cell?
Nobody called me...
Someone was here?     Inside the house?
(to Beth) You said it was okay.    She said she had something for Kyle...
(instant panic) Oh my god! Where's Kyle?
In his crib.
Beth streaks for the stairs.
How long since she was here?
A couple minutes. What's wrong?
Derek runs for the stairs. SAMANTHA (cont'd) (calling after them; now
You said it was okay!
Beth runs to the crib. To her horror, it's empty. Lisa le out a cry of anguish. Derek appears in the door. Lisa tur to him in desperate panic.
She took him! She took my baby!

Call 911!

Derek races into the garage, yanks open the driver's door gets in. He starts the engine, turns to back out and -- Surprise! There's Kyle is in the backseat, strapped into car seat, smiling at his Daddy.
Kyle...
Derek gets out, pulls open the back door and unstraps his son, then hesitates. What Derek sees makes his blood run cold. On the child's forehead... a perfect red lipstick kiss.
Kyle is being examined by A DOCTOR while Derek and Beth comfort him.
T
We pumped his stomach. X-ray and cat scan came back normal. We'll wait for the blood work but it appears he's completely fine. I don't see any reason why you can't take Bhim home in a couple hours.
(tearful relief) Thank you, Doctor.

erek and Beth confer with Reyes.       Beth is very agita

Apparently Lisa stole her sister's ID to buy a ticket and board a plane to LA earlier today, then used her sister's credit card to rent a car. The sister didn't even know she was gone until a few hours ago. She said Lisa had been doing well in therapy. She didn't know she checked herself out this morning...
She was in our house -- alone with our son.
he doctor says he's fine.

Find her.

Either that or...maybe she was trying to show you she could love him. off Derek's sickened reaction) People like Lisa... their emotions can turn on a dime. Beth scrambles over and finds a wedding photo of herself Derek. Again, her head has been removed.
ETH (cont'd) What kind of sick person...
Derek crouches down and holds Beth who begins to cry, her body shaking.
It's all right, it's all right...

As he holds his wife, Derek looks up and sees their reflection in the mirror -- twisted and distorted, like Lisa's mind.

(into the phone) L isten to me, you little bitch. This is Beth Charles and I just want you to know that if you ever... ever... come near my child or my house again... I'll kill you.

SET.

here's still that frostiness between them.

Derek Charles' office.

(happy to hear from her; keeps his voice down) L isa?

(hushed/secretive) Well, actually...
What?

(LAUGHS) Oh, that. That was Beth's doing. She's not handling this very well. Derek's just waiting for the right time to tell her he's leaving.

Well... Beth's headed down to San Diego tonight. Her mother is having some tests done. Derek is driving down first thing in the morning to be by her side. when she doesn't respond) Lisa? Did you hear me?

Patrick.

isa puts the champagne bottle on the counter, then hummin happily, she begins to open shelves until she finds two crystal champagne flutes. She takes them down. Now she looks for an ice bucket and finds it.

He can't work, glancing at his cell for Beth's call.

Beth is standing in the doorway, givi Lisa a deadly look, like a cat who's just trapped a mouse Beth takes notice of the rose petals on the bed and floor Lisa is wide-eyed, terrified, caught. Lisa's eyes dart around for escape.   Beth seems remarkab calm. BETH (cont'd) You can look all you want but you're not getting out of here. ot until I've given you the beating of your life... bitch.

isa bounces off the post, stunned. Beth is on her, slappi her hard, grabbing a handful of Lisa's hair, ripping it o by the roots as Lisa tries to get free. Lisa lets out a subhuman shriek of pain. (in pain; terrified,

Please... I'm sorry...

He doesn't love you! I'm the one he wants! (crazed; screaming) Why can't you get that through your head?
Lisa raises the bottle to hit her again. Beth lunges forward and tackles her. The bottle goes flyi as the two women thrash around on the floor.

(managing to sit up; defensive) Please... Beth...

Please. I'll go... I'll leave... I swear I'll never bother you again...
You got that right.
